content: Created `docs/e2e/requirements-ci.txt` as a concise, CI-focused, fully pinned e2e dependency set with inline comments mapping each package to its e2e/CI usage.

output.code:
from pathlib import Path
import json

target_path = Path('/mnt/data').joinpath('docs/e2e/requirements-ci.txt')
target_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

chunks = [
"""# CI-only Python dependencies for end-to-end (e2e) test runs.
# - Pinned versions keep CI reproducible.
# - Keep this file small: only what CI needs (not full dev deps).
# - Comments describe the feature/module that requires each dependency.""",
"""# Core test runner
pytest==8.3.4
pytest-xdist==3.6.1          # parallel e2e execution in CI
pytest-timeout==2.3.1        # hard-stop hung tests
pytest-rerunfailures==14.0   # rerun flaky tests when enabled
pytest-html==4.1.1           # optional HTML report artifact
pytest-metadata==3.1.1       # extra context in reports (build, platform, etc.)""",
"""# HTTP / API helpers commonly used in e2e suites
requests==2.32.3
tenacity==9.0.0              # retry/backoff for eventually-consistent systems""",
"""# Configuration & structured output
PyYAML==6.0.2                # parse workflow/test config files
python-dotenv==1.0.1         # load CI-provided .env files when present
rich==13.9.4                 # readable CLI logs in CI output""",
"""# Browser-driven e2e (install browser binaries separately in CI)
playwright==1.49.1           # UI e2e automation (Chromium/Firefox/WebKit)""",
]

final_text = '\n'.join(block.strip('\n') for block in chunks).strip() + '\n'
target_path.write_text(final_text, encoding='utf-8')

print('FILE_WRITTEN:docs/e2e/requirements-ci.txt')
print('DIR_STATE:' + json.dumps(sorted(str(p.relative_to(Path("/mnt/data"))) for p in target_path.parent.glob('*') if p.is_file())))

content.text: Created `docs/e2e/requirements-ci.txt` as a concise, CI-focused, fully pinned e2e dependency set with inline comments mapping each package to its e2e/CI usage.
